Issue Name: Gert Mask in The Hunger of Gerts Part 1 doesn't work
Solution (if any): Don't shift click the mask on. Put it in your helmet slot.

Issue Name: Priest won't let you in during Grave Digger
Notes: Might bamboozle you into thinking it's a Stage 3 issue, but it's not.
Solution (if any): Right click Drucksh with the Potion of Drunkness in your inventory. Don't right click while holding it as that's the cause of the issue.

Issue Name: Beanstalk in The Fortuneteller sends you back down/to a black box/teleports you down
Notes: It's a bit of a 5-6 issue
Solution (if any): Your questbook will say "Find the beanstalk" but you need it to say "Climb the beanstalk" to progress. Go back down the path and walk up again. You missed a trigger when walking up to the beanstalk. Do the parkour without any spells. Just don't use movement spells in general.

Issue Name: Captured Gert in The Hunger of Gerts Part 2 doesn't let you leave
Solution (if any): Wrong stairs. It's the wooden ramp, not the spiral staircase.

Issue Name: Captured Gert in The Hunger of Gerts Part 2 says nothing or "me eat human"
Solution (if any): Your questbook says "Talk to Captured Gert" or something of that sort. You probably missed a trigger, walk back, retrace your steps, and don't use movement spells.

Issue Name: Getting in the slums after /kill while unable to break the door with the cannon again in Dwarves and Doguns Part II

Solution (if any): A button should be nearby. Press it.

Issue Name: I have all the items but crafting doesn't work in Fantastic Voyage
Solution (if any): Are you sure you have Black Powder instead of Rock Dust? If it still fails, try clicking at different angles with a bare hand.

Issue Name: "It seems rude to just barge into somebody's house like that"
Solution (if any): This isn't a bug (It happens when you don't bring the bluecap mushrooms with you) but the quest got changed in 1.20 so this situation doesn't exist anymore.

Issue Name: Accidentally leaving the house at the end of One Thousand Meters Under
Solution (if any): Redoing the quest works as far as I know, but that's very unfortunate.
